intro: Enantia kummerae, commonly known as the Kummer's enantia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae, which includes cashew and poison ivy. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers that range from white to pale yellow. Enantia kummerae is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. It is also noted for its potential medicinal properties, though further research is needed to confirm its therapeutic uses.
